title: HAL, Jubilant Ingrevia among 10 stocks rise even as Israel-Iran conflict dampens market sentiment
description: Escalating Israel-Iran tensions sent Indian markets reeling, with the Sensex and Nifty 50 plummeting. Bucking the trend, shipping stocks soared on rising crude prices and container rate expectations. Jubilant Ingrevia rallied after a significant block deal, while defense stocks gained amid conflict concerns. Realty shares and Jubilant Foodworks also saw increases due to sector activity and stake offloading, respectively.
excerpt: The ongoing Israel-Iran conflict continues to have ripple effects across the global markets, and India’s stock market is no exception. Friday the 13th sent the Sensex lower by 1,338 points to 80,354.59, while the Nifty 50 index fell by 415.20 points to 24,473 in early trade.This was after tensions between Israel and Iran unfolded as the former launched widescale strikes against the latter. Only 5 Nifty50 stocks advanced today. Meanwhile, there were some stocks that defied the broader market sentiment today.Here are the stocks that defied today’s market sentiment: Rising Mideast Tensions

html:
Jun 13, 2025, 03:36:33 PM IST

1/6

Rising Mideast Tensions

The ongoing Israel-Iran conflict continues to have ripple effects across the global markets, and India’s stock market is no exception. Friday the 13th sent the Sensex lower by 1,338 points to 80,354.59, while the Nifty 50 index fell by 415.20 points to 24,473 in early trade.

This was after tensions between Israel and Iran unfolded as the former launched widescale strikes against the latter. Only 5 Nifty50 stocks advanced today. Meanwhile, there were some stocks that defied the broader market sentiment today.

Here are the stocks that defied today’s market sentiment:

iStock

Shares of shipping companies like Shipping Corporation of India and The Great Eastern Shipping Company rose 14.5% and 7.7% respectively, as tensions between Israel and Iran escalated, global markets were shaken, driving crude prices significantly higher and increasing expectations of a rise in container shipping rates.

TIL Creatives

Jubilant Ingrevia shares rallied 14.3% to their intraday high of Rs 778.05 on the BSE after likely witnessing a block deal of Rs 667 crore today, according to reports by CNBC TV-18.

ETMarkets.com

Shares of defence companies like BEL, BDL, HAL and Data Patterns surged up to 3.5% on Friday following Israel's launch of a series of military strikes on Iran, concerns of a wider conflict resurfaced, sparking heightened investor interest in defense-related companies.

TNN

Amid a surge in trade volumes in the realty sector, the shares of Valor Estate and Mahindra Lifespace Developers surged as much as 9.5% and 4.2%, respectively, on the BSE on Friday.

ETMarkets.com

Jubilant Foodworks shares jumped 3% in intraday trade today to their day’s high of Rs 688.55 on the BSE after the company’s promoters likely offloaded a 2% stake, or 1.32 crore shares, in the company in a block deal, according to a report by CNBC-TV18 citing sources.

(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of The Economic Times)

ETMarkets.com
